    • Field Detail

      • URL_PATTERN

        public static final Pattern URL_PATTERN
        Pattern for recognition of URLs. The pattern tries to find URLs as defined in RFC2396. However there are some differences
        • The protocol is limited to HTTP, HTTPS, FTP and FTPS
        • The protocol can be omitted if URL starts with www. and will then default to HTTP
        • The domain can contain any unicode character of class letter and not just a-z
        • The path component can contain any unicode character of class letter and not just a-z
        • The path component can only contain one segment

    • Method Detail

      • assertIsValidUrl

        public static void assertIsValidUrl(String url)
        Checks if url is well formed. If not an IllegalArgumentException is thrown
        Parameters:
        url - the url to check

      • convertAnchorsToString

        public static String convertAnchorsToString(String content)
        Parses a string for HTML anchor elements and replaces a shortened URL (suffixed by ...) within the the anchor with the href value. If the anchor does not contain any URL the href value is appended to the anchor content (encapsulated by parentheses). The anchor tag and attributes will be removed.
        Parameters:
        content - the content to parse
        Returns:
        the processed content

      • getProtocolHostPort

        public static String getProtocolHostPort(String url,
                                         boolean stripUserInfo)
        Get a substring of an absolute URL from beginning up to the path, excluding the path and without a trailing slash.
        Parameters:
        url - the absolute URL to process
        stripUserInfo - whether to remove the user info if contained
        Returns:
        the substring or null if the provided URL is not absolute, has an unsupported protocol or no host.

      • insertSessionIdInUrl

        public static String insertSessionIdInUrl(String url,
                                          String sessionId)
        Insert the session ID in the URL in the form ";jessionid=SESSION_ID". Takes care of query strings.
        Parameters:
        url - the url to modify
        sessionId - the sessionId to insert
        Returns:
        the url/uri with the session id

      • isAbsoluteHttpUrl

        public static boolean isAbsoluteHttpUrl(String url)
        Test whether the given URL is an absolute URL using the HTTP or HTTPS protocol.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL to check
        Returns:
        true if the URL is not null and absolute

      • isAbsoluteUrl

        public static boolean isAbsoluteUrl(String url)
        Test whether the provided URL is absolute.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL to test
        Returns:
        true if the URL starts with a scheme name as defined in RFC 1738

      • shortenUrl

        public static String shortenUrl(String protocolHostPart,
                                String pathPart,
                                String queryPart,
                                String fragmentIdentifier)
        Shortens a URL.
        Parameters:
        protocolHostPart - the protocol and host part of the URL including the port
        pathPart - the path part of the URL; can be null
        queryPart - the query part of the URL; can be null
        fragmentIdentifier - the fragment identifier of the URL; can be null
        Returns:
        the shortened URL

      • urlEncodeUrlPath

        public static String urlEncodeUrlPath(String path)

        URL encode (application/x-www-form-urlencoded format) the path component of a URL. The method uses the UTF-8 encoding scheme.

        Note: the application/x-www-form-urlencoded format encodes spaces with the plus character. For proper URI encoding better use UriUtils.encodeUriComponent(String)!
        Parameters:
        path - the path component of a URL. If parts of the path are already URL encoded these will be omitted
        Returns:
        the encoded path component
